content: This morning, I discovered that I can no longer add items to my Google calendar and that any new items added on my phone did not sync. Having read a couple of articles I then tried to add my Google calendar as a network calendar and Google accepted the request but Thunderbird reports that my "credentials were not accepted" - despite the fact the Google sent me an email saying that Thunderbird now had full access to my calendar. title: Messages can be sent, but a network error message appears, informing that the message has been sent but not saved.
content:
I have an intriguing problem. I am using the latest version, currently 128.8.1 (automatic update), Windows 11 is also updated. Desktop computer, Ethernet connection, network speed 900mbps.

I use 10 accounts in the program, most of the time the program connects only to gmail accounts, and IMAP accounts from other providers are constantly being connected. Sometimes hours pass until a new message appears in the program (there is no message download, simply, the other accounts are as if without updates). Messages can be sent, but a network error message appears, informing that the message has been sent but not saved.

I know that the mail arrives because I use a different device, I only have the problem on this equipment.

Drivers are up to date, Thunderbird reinstalled, started in maintenance mode, database re-indexed. Nothing helps.

Any ideas? Thanks!
creator: podhalanin

The calendars are no google servers. The problem started occurring 2-3 months ago.

What to do?

title: Suspicious failure of Thunderbird connection to Google calendar
content:
Two days ago I got a suspicious message in the form of a window that opened on my Firefox browser, purportedly from the author of Google Calendar Provider, soliciting contributions. Not expecting the window, and not certain of its authenticity I closed it.

Yesterday my calendar failed by popping up two notifications from my Google calendar via Thunderbird. I could not dismiss them. Other users have occasionally noted this issue. I tried closing and opening Thunderbird and rebooting. The alerts persisted.

So I removed the Google calendar from Thunderbird. The alerts went away. Hooray!

But when I reinstalled my Google calendar through Calendar Provider, the calendar showed up on the list of calendars, but non of its events appeared. Synchronization, closing Thunderbird, and rebooting did not help.

I can't tell whether I was hit by some kind of e-blackmail (pay up or else), or if something changed in Thunderbird, or what. No antivirus measures have been triggered, and my Windows 11 system is set up as a local account without administrative privileged. I am up to date on Windows updates. Running Thunderbird 128.8.1 esr

title: Zmena hesla na IMAP účte google imap.gmail.com
content:
Dobrý deň. V thunderbirde obsluhujem viac účtov na imap.gmail.com Všetko fungovalo dlhé roky OK až do okamihu, keď som cez WEB gmailu zmeni heslo k jednomu účtu. Zobrazí sa okno na Oauth2 prihlásenie https://accounts.google.com/_/bscframe s predvyplnenýmúčtom Google. Okno sa zdá OK, ale keď kliknem na ĎALEJ aby sa zobrazilokno s výzvou na zadanie hesla, tak to vráti chybu 400 bez bližších detailov. Keď link https://accounts.google.com/v3/signin/identifier?app_domain=http://localhost&client_id=40696465 atd vložím do anonymného okna firefoxu, tak sa zobrazí také isté okno a po klik na ďalší zas zhavaruje, akurát s chybou 500. Aj v Chrome. Na mobile s Aquamail prebehne zmena hesla správnym spôsobom. Zmazal som v TB uložené heslá pre daný účet a nepomohlo. Zmazal som uložené heslá pre iný google účte a i keď som heslo nemenil, tak som skončil s rovnakým problémom... Účet som z TB odstránil (bez zmazania dat) a znovu pridal a nedostal som sa zas cez heslo... Keď sa dívam cez WEB na správu gmail účtu, tak v Aplikácie a služby tretích strán le len aquamail a nie Thunderbird. Vo funkčných účtoch mám aj TB. Dokonca i v tom druhom, ktorému som zmazal heslá, ale nezmenil. Tiež sa nemôže autorizovať ale TB v aplik 3 strán je...

Mám najnovší TB 115.18.1.esr

Pomooooooc :-(
creator: martin180

title: Impossible ajouter un Nouvel Evenement
content: Bonjour, sur Thunderbird Version 128.8.1 esr 32 bit, Dans agenda, le bouton "+ Nouvel évènement" est grisé et inopérant. Mon agenda est "GMAIL" Comment le réactiver. Merci pour votre aide Cordialement
creator: jf.loichot

title: Horizontal scrolling when replying
content:
When I reply to an HTML message, a horizontal scroll bar appears. Horizontal scrolling or widening the window is necessary to read the message that I am responding to. But sometimes I must widen the window to an extreme width, which I don't like to do, or scroll horizontally to read the text, which I don't like to do. I end up having to look at the original message in a separate window in order to write a response to it because I cannot read it easily in the quoted text area of the composition window.

Other e-mail programs wrap text better within a window of any width and they do not require horizontal scrolling.

The only way I know to deal with this problem in Thunderbird is to use the re-wrap menu option. But even that does not get rid of horizontal scrolling, and I do not like the fixed line length that it imposes. I want text to wrap dynamically in windows, as it does in, well, just about every text handling program that I've used in the last 40 years.

Is there a better way to eliminate the need for horizontal scrolling? Something in configuration settings? Something in CSS?

In case it matters: I write plain-text messages.
creator: mozilla98

title: Unified folder wont allow me to move emails to subfolder
content:
I have Unified email set up to show all emails received and sent from 4 accounts. One of these accounts allow me to move my emails to a subfolder, but the others do not.

When I try to move the emails to the subfolder thunderbird simply ignores the action. Sometimes it lets me move them when I am accessing mail from the main folder instead of the unified folder, but it is not predictable if it will work or not. The issue only began when I set up the Unified Folder, which I really like and prefer to keep in place.

The one that works is a gmail based email. The others run off of a smaller hosting company (inmotion hosting). Inmotion has no advice. Any ideas on how to solve this issue in the community or from thunderbird itself?
creator: wdg3

title: Emails desaparecem ao reiniciar Thunderbird (136.0.1 Nebula)
content:
Suporte, Olá!

Problema: Após concluir (com sucesso) a importação de uma instalação anterior (migração de equipamento) vejo todos os emails. Contudo se eu fechar e abrir o Thunderbird emails desaparecem.

Detalhe: - Logo após importação é possível ver os emails das 4x caixas. - Após fechar e abrir o Thunderbird

Cenário: Meu Thunderbird estava configurado com 4 contas (2x contas ativas/existentes e 2x contas antigas que não existem mais/backup)

Informações adicionais: - O profile anterior do Thunderbird possui ~114GB (Cada backup que "não existe mais" tem ~50GB) - O problema ocorre mesmo após concluir a indexação das pastas. - Thunderbird versão 1.36.0.1 (64-bits) Nebula - Feita a cópia da pasta "Profile" do Desktop para o "Notebook" antes da importação.

Servidores de email: - Conta principal (Ativa): Localweb Webmail - Conta secundária (Ativa): Localweb Webmail - Conta terciaria (Desativada/Backup): MDaemon (on premises) - Conta quartenaria (Desativada/Backup): MDaemon (on primeses)

Evidencia em video: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UwByemejRrOjkRUicM1R5nbgD9sbzpTd/view?usp=sharing
creator: emanoel.silva

title: Google Calendar Broke Today - New Event Greyed out - Accounts will not import calendars
content:
This is a strange issue. I've been using Thunderbird for over 15 years, and today, while working with a client, I attempted to click "New Event," but it was greyed out. After ending the call, I started troubleshooting.

Steps I’ve Taken:

  • Re-added all existing accounts—no change.
  • Tried adding a fresh calendar—received a strange error (which I didn’t copy) about encryption or a "request missing required authentication credential."
  • Uninstalled Provider for Google Calendar and removed all accounts.
  • Same authentication error—Google sign-in system wouldn't appear.
  • Searched Google for recent similar issues—nothing in the past 30 days, nothing within the past year.
  • Restarted my computer.
  • Was able to re-add all accounts, but nothing is syncing.
  • At this point, I’m completely baffled. No system changes have been made. I'm running Windows 10 with the latest version of Thunderbird and its extensions. My system clock and timezone are correct.

Any help would be greatly appreciated!
creator: josh98
